title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point
Description may include:

· DNA sequence comparison between the two bacterial strains

· RNA sequence comparison between the two bacterial strains

· Protein sequence comparison between the two bacterial strains

· Biochemical strategies comparison

· Components of ribosomes comparison

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Description may include:

· ↓ genetic distance ↓ antagonism

· ↑ genetic relatedness ↓ antagonism

· ↑ genetic distance ↑ antagonism

· ↓ genetic relatedness ↑ antagonism

· There is a threshold of genetic relatedness beyond which probability of antagonism increases sharply

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point

· By producing antimicrobial substances, the bacteria inhibit the growth of strains that are genetically unrelated.

· By producing antimicrobial substances, the bacteria promote the growth of bacteria that are genetically related.

· Individuals who do not produce antimicrobial substances but are genetically related to those who do gain a selective advantage due to reduced competition/decreased energy expenditure.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

· By producing antimicrobial substances, the bacteria inhibit the growth of strains that are genetically unrelated.

· By producing antimicrobial substances, the bacteria promote the growth of bacteria that are genetically related.

· Individuals who do not produce antimicrobial substances but are genetically related to those who do gain a selective advantage due to reduced competition/decreased energy expenditure.

Student response earns one of the following points.

· By producing antimicrobial substances, the bacteria inhibit the growth of strains that are genetically unrelated.

· By producing antimicrobial substances, the bacteria promote the growth of bacteria that are genetically related.

· Individuals who do not produce antimicrobial substances but are genetically related to those who do gain a selective advantage due to reduced competition/decreased energy expenditure.
